item.title: Hounds of Faith and Fury
item.description:
Project Objective

To print and hand-bind a draft of a fantasy novel I wrote, and create a cover that effectively communicates the theme and tone of the story.

Target Audience

Readers of young adult fantasy.

Design Process

Interior Layout

I laid out the entire 90k-word novel in InDesign, using a template for a previous project that I tweaked and refined for this project. I used the Monarcha Book font for all the interior text, and used hand-drawn icons from the cover design for the chapter headings.

item.title: Time for Tea Card Game
item.description:
Project Objective

To design a game for families and friends that creates opportunities for connection while celebrating tea.

Target Audience

Tea drinkers and families or groups of friends who enjoy playing games together.

Design Process

Hand drawing assets to develop characters representing different tea-making ingredients, vectorizing them, and creating playing cards that are visually engaging and usable.

item.title: Font Design for a Graphic Design Course
item.description: This was a straightforward assignment from a graphic design professor at the University of the Fraser Valley. Using Adobe InDesign and/or Illustrator, as well as in-class instruction and supplemental notes, each student was directed to create their own font from scratch. The font had to include all letters from A-Z, could be either lowercase or uppercase, and needed to include an example of the font beind used in a sentence.

Miraya Engelage and Elise Volkman bring you writing, editing, and reading tips from the tea-tables of their living rooms. Whether you’re an experienced author or new writer, pour yourself a cup of tea and join them for discussions on first drafts, querying, and everything in between.
